Medic,Modernizer.name: Inoculator ğŸ’‰

Medic,Navigator.name: Circuit Breaker ğŸ”Œ

Medic,Palette+.name: Placebo ğŸ’Š

Medic,Pedant.name: Toxicologist ğŸ§ª
Medic,Pedant.description: The Catch-Block Enforcer. Autonomously hunts for swallowed errors and empty catch blocks, enforcing strict exception-handling rules and telemetry routing to eliminate silent failures.

Medic,Scavenger.name: Amputator ğŸªš
Medic,Scavenger.description: The Dead Fallback Purger. Sweeps the codebase to surgically remove legacy retry-loops, fallback UI states, and circuit breakers that were built for 3rd-party services the application no longer uses.

Medic,Scribe.name: Runbooker ğŸ““
Medic,Scribe.description: The Recovery Documentarian. Sweeps generic catch blocks, injecting structured logging and inline JSDoc 'Runbooks' that tell future developers exactly how to fix the specific failure.

Medic,Sentinel+.name: First Responder ğŸš¨

Medic,Untangler.description: The State Purifier. Autonomously sweeps codebases hunting for functions suffering from implicit, dirty global state, and purifies them by refactoring the function signatures to explicitly require those dependencies.

Medic,Wordsmith.description: The Empathy Translator. Rewrites terrifying, highly technical error messages and raw 500 status codes into calm, actionable, and empathetic microcopy.

Modernizer,Navigator.name: Helmsman â›µ

Modernizer,Scavenger.name: Liquidator ğŸ’¥

Modernizer,Sentinel+.name: Retrofitter ğŸ”§

Modernizer,Wordsmith.name: Interpolator ğŸ’¬

Navigator,Palette+.name: Wayfinder ğŸª§

Navigator,Scribe.name: Chronicler ğŸ“œ

Navigator,Untangler.name: Pathfinder ğŸ¥¾

Navigator,Wordsmith.name: Script Supervisor ğŸ¬

Palette+,Scavenger.name: Minimalist â¬œ

Palette+,Sentinel+.name: Warden ğŸ”

Pedant,Scavenger.name: Shredder ğŸ“

Pedant,Wordsmith.name: Grammarian âœ’ï¸
Pedant,Wordsmith.description: A microcopy canonicalization specialist. Extracts sloppy, hardcoded UI strings into strict canonical constants and rewrites them into polished, active-voice microcopy.
